contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Larry T. Justus''' (died 20 October 2002) was a [[United States Republican Party|Republican]] member of the [[North Carolina House of Representatives]] from [[Hendersonville, North Carolina]]; he served for nine consecutive terms. Justus was seeking re-election for a tenth term in the General Assembly when he died in late October 2002. Because his name remained on the ballot and he received a majority of votes cast, his widow, [[Carolyn K. Justus]], was named by the local Republican party to fill his seat in the House of Representatives during his tenth term. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Justus, Larry T. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 20 October 2002 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Justus, Larry T.}} [[Category:2002 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:Year of birth missing]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
